snippet: An inquiry by the attorney general’s office found that minority shoppers were disproportionately followed and, sometimes, detained at Macy’s flagship Herald Square store.
abstract: Macy's agrees to pay $650,000 fine and hire independent monitor to address complaints that minority shoppers have faced heightened surveillance and, in some cases, wrongful detention at its flagship store in Midtown Manhattan.
lead_paragraph: An inquiry by the attorney general’s office found that minority shoppers were disproportionately followed and, sometimes, detained at Macy’s flagship Herald Square store.

headline.main: Macy’s to Pay $650,000 to Resolve Bias Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Macy’s to Pay $650,000 to Resolve Bias Inquiry
